Linting Rules

Linting Rules

This is project for managing linting rules that can be applied as part of API governance at design, develop, and build time. You can find a collection in this public workspace where you can use these rules to lint an OpenAPI.


Rulesets

These are a list of the rulesets.

Contact - A set of rules centered on teh contact information.

Link
Discussion
Descriptions - A ruleset that focus on descriptions.

Link
Discussion
Starter - A simple starter ruleset for applying against API designs.

Link
Discussion

Rules

These are a list of the rules.

(Link) - 

<hr />
description: All YAML/JSON definitions MUST follow fields-camelCase and be ASCII alphanumeric
  characters or <code class="highlighter-rouge">_</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">$</code>.
given: $.definitions[<em>]~
message:  MUST follow camelCase and be ASCII alphanumeric characters
  or <code class="highlighter-rouge">_</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">$</code>.
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: /^[a-z$_]{1}[A-Z09$_]</em>/

description: All YAML/JSON definitions MUST follow fields-camelCase and be ASCII alphanumeric
  characters or <code class="highlighter-rouge">_</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">$</code>.
given: $.definitions[<em>]~
message:  MUST follow camelCase and be ASCII alphanumeric characters
  or <code class="highlighter-rouge">_</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">$</code>.
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: /^[a-z$_]{1}[A-Z09$_]</em>/
(Link) - 

<hr />
description: All <code class="highlighter-rouge">HTTP</code> headers MUST use <code class="highlighter-rouge">Hyphenated-Pascal-Case</code> notation
given: $..parameters[?(@.in == header)].name
message: 'HTTP headers MUST follow Hyphenated-Pascal-Case notation
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: /^([A-Z][a-z0-9]-)<em>([A-Z][a-z0-9])+/
type: style

description: All <code class="highlighter-rouge">HTTP</code> headers MUST use <code class="highlighter-rouge">Hyphenated-Pascal-Case</code> notation
given: $..parameters[?(@.in == header)].name
message: 'HTTP headers MUST follow Hyphenated-Pascal-Case notation
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: /^([A-Z][a-z0-9]-)</em>([A-Z][a-z0-9])+/
type: style
(Link) - 

<hr />
description: All HTTP headers SHOULD NOT include X- headers (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6648).
given: $..parameters[?(@.in == header)].name
message: HTTP headers SHOULD NOT include X- prefix.
recommended: true
severity: warn
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    notMatch: /^(x|X)-/
type: style

description: All HTTP headers SHOULD NOT include X- headers (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6648).
given: $..parameters[?(@.in == header)].name
message: HTTP headers SHOULD NOT include X- prefix.
recommended: true
severity: warn
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    notMatch: /^(x|X)-/
type: style
(Link) - 

<hr />
description: All models MUST have a valid example.
formats:

  - oas2
given: $..parameters..[?(@.in == body &amp;&amp; (@.example || @.schema.$ref))]
message:  MUST have a valid example.
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
function: truthy

description: All models MUST have a valid example.
formats:
  - oas2
given: $..parameters..[?(@.in == body &amp;&amp; (@.example || @.schema.$ref))]
message:  MUST have a valid example.
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
function: truthy

<hr />
description: ALL requests MUST go through <code class="highlighter-rouge">https</code> protocol only
formats:

  - oas2
given: $
message: Schemes MUST be https and no other value is allowed.
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
field: schemes
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    items:
      enum:
      - https
      type: string
    maxItems: 1
    type: array
type: style

description: ALL requests MUST go through <code class="highlighter-rouge">https</code> protocol only

  - oas2
given: $
message: Schemes MUST be https and no other value is allowed.
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
field: schemes
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    items:
      enum:
      - https
      type: string

    type: array

severity: warn
then:
function: schema

      type: string
    type: array

description: All error responses MUST be of media type <code class="highlighter-rouge">application/problem+json</code>
formats:

  - oas2
given: $.paths..responses[?( @property &gt;= 400 &amp;&amp; @property &lt; 600 )]
message: Error response document MUST follow application/problem+json: 
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
field: schema.example
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    $ref: ./supermodel/adidas/api/ProblemDetail.yaml
type: style

<hr />
description: All success responses MUST be of media type <code class="highlighter-rouge">application/hal+json</code> or
  <code class="highlighter-rouge">application/problem+json</code>
formats:

  - oas3
given: $.paths..responses[?( @property == 200 )].content[*]~
message: Response documents MUST be of application/hal+json or application/problem+json
media types: 
recommended: true
severity: error
then:
function: enumeration
functionOptions:
  values:
    
      - application/hal+json
      - application/problem+json

description: Examples must be valid against their defined schema.
formats:

  - oas3
given: $..definitions..[?(@property !== properties &amp;&amp; @.example &amp;&amp; (@.type || @.format
|| @.$ref))]
message: 
recommended: true
severity: 0
then:
function: schemaPath
functionOptions:
  field: example
  schemaPath: $
type: validation
(Link) - 

<hr />
description: Examples must be valid against their defined schema.
formats:

  - oas3
given: $..parameters..[?(@.in == body)]..[?(@property !== properties &amp;&amp; @.example
&amp;&amp; ( @.type || @.format || @.$ref ))]
message: 
recommended: true
severity: 0
then:
function: schemaPath
functionOptions:
  field: example
  schemaPath: $
type: validation

<hr />
description: Path parameters MUST follow camelCase
given: $..parameters[?(@.in == path)].name
message:  path parameter is not camelCase: 
recommended: true
severity: warn
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: ^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]+$

  functionOptions:
    match: ^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]+$

<hr />
description: All YAML/JSON paths MUST follow kebab-case
given: $.paths[<em>]~
message:  is not kebab-case: 
recommended: true
severity: warn
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: ^\/([a-z0-9]+(-[a-z0-9]+)</em>)?(\/[a-z0-9]+(-[a-z0-9]+)<em>|\/{.+})</em>$

<hr />
description: A GET request MUST NOT accept a body<code class="highlighter-rouge"> parameter
given: $.paths..get.parameters..in
severity: error
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    notMatch: /^body$/
...
description: A 'GET' request MUST NOT accept a 'body</code> parameter
given: $.paths..get.parameters..in
severity: error
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    notMatch: /^body$/
(Link) - 

<hr />
x-tags:

  - it
  - 
    RAC_REST_FORMAT_004
description: |-
To improve interoperability, integer and number formats are constrained
to a shared subset.

    See recommendation RAC_REST_FORMAT_004.
message: Type format is , expected one of [int32, int64]. 
formats:
  
  - oas3
severity: hint
recommended: true
given: |
$.[?(@.type==integer)]
then:
field: format
function: enumeration
functionOptions:
  values:
    
      - int32
      - int64

  field: get
  function: truthy

description: OpenAPI <code class="highlighter-rouge">servers</code> must be present and non-empty array.
severity: error
formats:

  - oas3
given: $
then:
field: servers
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    items:
      type: object
    minItems: 1
    type: array

description: OpenAPI <code class="highlighter-rouge">servers</code> must be present and non-empty array.
severity: error
formats:
  - oas3
given: $
then:
field: servers
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    items:
      type: object
    minItems: 1
    type: array
(Link) - 

description: |-
  Array size should be limited to mitigate resource exhaustion attacks.
  This can be done using <code class="highlighter-rouge">maxItems</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">minItems</code>, like in the example
  below.

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  Limited:
    type: array
    maxItems: 10
    items:
      type: string
      format: date
</code></pre></div></div>

You should ensure that the schema referenced in  <code class="highlighter-rouge">items</code> is constrained too.

If you delegate input validation to a library or framework,
  be sure to test it thoroughly and ensure that it verifies <code class="highlighter-rouge">maxItems</code>.
message: Schema of type array must specify maxItems and minItems.<br />
formats:

  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given:
  - $.[?(@.type==array)]
then:
  - field: maxItems
function: defined
  - field: minItems
function: defined
(Link) -

severity: error
message: Did not expect at . Define example data on each property
  in the object instead
given: $.paths.<em>.</em>.requestBody..[?(@.items)][?(@.type == object)]
then:

  - field: example
function: falsy

severity: error

  - field: example
function: falsy

<hr />
description: Operation should have a summary or description.
message: Operation should have a summary or description.
severity: warn
given:

  - $.paths[*][?( @property === get &amp;&amp; !@.summary &amp;&amp; !@.description )]
  - $.paths[*][?( @property === put &amp;&amp; !@.summary &amp;&amp; !@.description )]
  - $.paths[*][?( @property === post &amp;&amp; !@.summary &amp;&amp; !@.description )]
  - $.paths[*][?( @property === patch &amp;&amp; !@.summary &amp;&amp; !@.description )]
  - $.paths[*][?( @property === delete &amp;&amp; !@.summary &amp;&amp; !@.description )]

<hr />
description: |-
  Cache usage SHOULD be extensively detailed in the <code class="highlighter-rouge">description</code> property
  to avoid data leaks or the usage of stale data.

This rule should ensure in some way that the api provider
  documented extensively the cache usage to avoid data leaks
  or usage of stale data.

For now this ruleset tests:

  - the presence of following keywords
in the <code class="highlighter-rouge">description</code>: <code class="highlighter-rouge">max-age</code>, <code class="highlighter-rouge">private</code>, <code class="highlighter-rouge">no-store</code>, <code class="highlighter-rouge">no-cache</code>.
  - that one and only one between Expires and Cache-Control is used.


<code class="highlighter-rouge">Cache-Control</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">Expires</code> should not be used in conjuction,
  because <code class="highlighter-rouge">Cache-Control</code> overrides <code class="highlighter-rouge">Expires</code> when <code class="highlighter-rouge">max-age</code> is set.
  Instead if neither <code class="highlighter-rouge">Cache-Control</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">Expires</code> are set, clients MAY use euristic cache
  like described in RFC7234.
message: Cache usage SHOULD be documented when used.
formats:

  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given: $..[parameters][?(@.in == header &amp;&amp; @.name.match(/Cache-Control/i))]
then:
  - field: description
function: truthy
  - 
    field: description
function: pattern
functionOptions:
  match: .<em>(max-age|private|no-store|no-cache).</em>

description: |-

to avoid data leaks or the usage of stale data.

or usage of stale data.

    For now this ruleset tests:
    
      - the presence of following keywords

      - that one and only one between Expires and Cache-Control is used.
    

    <code class="highlighter-rouge">Cache-Control</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">Expires</code> should not be used in conjuction,
because <code class="highlighter-rouge">Cache-Control</code> overrides <code class="highlighter-rouge">Expires</code> when <code class="highlighter-rouge">max-age</code> is set.
Instead if neither <code class="highlighter-rouge">Cache-Control</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">Expires</code> are set, clients MAY use euristic cache
like described in RFC7234.

description: |-
  By default, jsonschema allows additionalProperties. This means
  that schema validators can be bypassed using further, unspecified
  fields. While forbidding additionalProperties can create rigidity and hinder
  the evolution of an API - eg making it hard to accept new parameters
  or fields - it is possible that this flexibility can be used
  to bypass the schema validator and force the application to process
  unwanted information.
message: Objects should not allow additionalProperties. Disable them with <code class="highlighter-rouge">additionalProperties:
  false</code> or constraint them.
formats:

  - oas3

recommended: true

<table>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>description:</td>
      <td>2-</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

WARN: This rule is under implementation and just provides an hint.

Error management is a key enabler of a resilient API ecosystem.
  Enforcing a consistent schema for errors between different APIs,
  enables client to properly implement an error management strategy,
  with positive impacts for users.

Errors should return RFC7807 objects. Instead, this schema
  seems to use non standard properties such as:
  <code class="highlighter-rouge">message</code>, <code class="highlighter-rouge">msg</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">code</code>.

An error of the following form

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  {
    "msg": "Book with id: 123 does not exist.",
    "code": 6063
  }
</code></pre></div></div>

can be expressed in RFC7807 with

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  {
    "detail": "Book with id: 123 does not exist.",
    "type": "https://api.example/v1/errors/6063",
    "status": 404,
    "title": "Not Found"
  }
</code></pre></div></div>

Returning an URI in <code class="highlighter-rouge">type</code>, instead of an opaque <code class="highlighter-rouge">code</code> can help
  the client in better identifying the error; moreover the URI
  though it should not be dereferenced automatically, can return
  an actual resource providing guidance in addressing the issue.

See recommendation RAC_REST_NAME_007.
message: Error response doesnt seem to match RFC7807. Are you sure it is ok? 
formats:

  - oas3
severity: hint
recommended: true
given: $.[responses][?(@property.match(/^(4|5|default)/))][[schema]][properties].*~
then:
field: @key
function: pattern
functionOptions:
  notMatch: message|code|msg
(Link) -

severity: error
formats:

  - oas2
type: style
message: Schemes MUST be https and no other value is allowed.
given: $.schemes
then:
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    type: array
    items:
      type: string
      enum:
      - https
    maxItems: 1

description: |-
Schema of type number or integer must specify a format

x-tags (Link) - 

x-tags:

  - 
    it
description: |-
Ratelimiting API preserves a service and limits attack scenario
<a href="https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security">see API4:2019 Lack of Resources &amp; Rate Limiting</a>.

    APIs should use the following headers at least on successful responses:
    
      - <code class="highlighter-rouge">X-RateLimit-Limit</code>: number of total requests in a give time window
      - <code class="highlighter-rouge">X-RateLimit-Remaining</code>: remaining requests in the current window
      - <code class="highlighter-rouge">X-RateLimit-Reset</code>: number of seconds before the window resets
    

    An example set of headers is the following

    <div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>X-Ratelimit-Limit: 100
X-Ratelimit-Remaining: 40
X-Ratelimit-Reset: 12
</code></pre></div>    </div>

    A standardization proposal for ratelimit headers is ongoning
inside the IETF HTTPAPI Workgroup.
See <a href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-httpapi-ratelimit-headers/">the draft</a>
message: Missing ratelimit headers. <br />
formats:
  
  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given: $.[responses][?(@property[0] == 2 )][headers]
then:
  - functionOptions:
  properties:
    
      - X-RateLimit-Limit
      - RateLimit-Limit
function: xor
    
  
  - functionOptions:
  properties:
    
      - X-RateLimit-Remaining
      - RateLimit-Remaining
function: xor
    
  
  - functionOptions:
  properties:
    
      - X-RateLimit-Reset
      - RateLimit-Reset
function: xor
(Link) - 

<hr />
description: |-
  When a client is either:

  - throttled out with a 429 status code;
  - warned about a temporary server issue with a 503 status code;
  the server should explicitly communicate how long to wait
  before issuing further requests using the Retry-After header.


Retry-After is defined in RFC7231.
message: Missing ratelimit header:  in 
formats:

  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given: $.[responses][?(@property == 429 || @property == 503  )][headers]
then:
field: Retry-After
function: truthy

(Link) - 

description: |-
  By default, jsonschema allows additionalProperties. This means
  that schema validators can be bypassed using further, unspecified
  fields. While forbidding additionalProperties can create rigidity and hinder
  the evolution of an API - eg making it hard to accept new parameters
  or fields - it is possible that this flexibility can be used
  to bypass the schema validator and force the application to process
  unwanted information.
message: Objects should not allow additionalProperties. Disable them with <code class="highlighter-rouge">additionalProperties:
  false</code> or constraint them.
formats:

  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given:
  - $.[?(@.type==object &amp;&amp; @.additionalProperties==true)]
then:
  - field: additionalProperties
function: falsy
(Link) - 

description: |-
  By default, jsonschema allows additionalProperties. This means
  that schema validators can be bypassed using further, unspecified
  fields.
message: Objects should not allow additionalProperties. Disable them with <code class="highlighter-rouge">additionalProperties:
  false</code> or constraint them.
formats:

  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given:
  - $.[?(@.type==object &amp;&amp; ! @.additionalProperties)]
then:
  - field: additionalProperties
function: defined

description: |-
  Numeric values should be limited in size to mitigate resource exhaustion
  using <code class="highlighter-rouge">maximum</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">minimum</code>.

If you delegate input validation to a library or framework,
  be sure to test it thoroughly.
message: Schema of type number or integer must specify a maximum and a minimum.

formats:

  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given:
  - $.[?(@.type==number)]
  - $.[?(@.type==integer)]
then:
  - field: maximum
function: defined
  - field: minimum
function: defined
x-tags (Link) - 

x-tags:

  grant types are now considered insecure\nand MUST not be used, including <code class="highlighter-rouge">implicit</code>
  and <code class="highlighter-rouge">password</code>.\nThe new <a href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-1-01">OAuth2.1</a>
  \nstill in draft, removes them and suggests to\nreplace the <code class="highlighter-rouge">implicit</code> with <code class="highlighter-rouge">authorizationCode</code>

(Link) - 

description: |-
  String length should be limited to avoid an attacker
  to send very long strings to your service.

You can do this in different ways:

  - specify a <code class="highlighter-rouge">maxLength</code>
  - constraint the possible values with an <code class="highlighter-rouge">enum</code>
  - use a constrained <code class="highlighter-rouge">format</code> like <code class="highlighter-rouge">date</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">date-time</code>.


A constrained string using the <code class="highlighter-rouge">date</code> format.

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  ConstrainedString:
    type: string
    format: date
</code></pre></div></div>

Another constrained string using <code class="highlighter-rouge">maxLength</code>.
  You can always add further constraints using a
  <code class="highlighter-rouge">pattern</code> or a <code class="highlighter-rouge">format</code>.

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  ZipCode:
    type: string
    maxLength: 5
    pattern: '[0-9]{5}'
</code></pre></div></div>

For further security, you can always limit string length even
  in conjunction with <code class="highlighter-rouge">format</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">pattern</code>.
message: Strings (non enum) must specify a maximum length.<br />
formats:

  - oas3
severity: warn
recommended: true
given:
  - $.[?(@.type==string &amp;&amp; !@.enum &amp;&amp; @.format!=date &amp;&amp; @.format !=date-time )]
then:
  - field: maxLength
function: defined
(Link) - 

description: |-
  String length should be limited to avoid an attacker
  to send very long strings to your service.

You can do this in different ways:

  - specify a <code class="highlighter-rouge">maxLength</code>
  - constraint the possible values with an <code class="highlighter-rouge">enum</code>
  - use a constrained <code class="highlighter-rouge">format</code> like <code class="highlighter-rouge">date</code> or <code class="highlighter-rouge">date-time</code>.


A constrained string using the <code class="highlighter-rouge">date</code> format.

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  ConstrainedString:
    type: string
    format: date
</code></pre></div></div>

Another constrained string using <code class="highlighter-rouge">maxLength</code>.
  You can always add further constraints using a
  <code class="highlighter-rouge">pattern</code> or a <code class="highlighter-rouge">format</code>.

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  ZipCode:
    type: string
    maxLength: 5
    pattern: '[0-9]{5}'
</code></pre></div></div>

For further security, you can always limit string length even
  in conjunction with <code class="highlighter-rouge">format</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">pattern</code>.
message: Strings (non enum) must specify a pattern or a format. 
formats:

  - oas3
severity: hint
recommended: true
given:
  - $.[?(@.type==string &amp;&amp; !@.enum &amp;&amp; @.format!=date &amp;&amp; @.format !=date-time )]
then:
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    type: object
    anyOf:
    - required:
      - pattern
    - required:
      - format
    additionalProperties: true

use-problem-json-for-errors (Link) - Error management is a key enabler of a resilient API ecosystem. Enforcing a consistent schema for errors between different APIs, enables client to properly implement an error management strategy, with positive impacts for users. Error responses should return one of the media-type defined in RFC7807: - `application/problem+json` - `application/problem+xml` An example of a valid response: ``` responses: "503": content: application/problem+json: schema: ... ```

use-problem-json-for-errors:
  description: |-

<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code><span class="n">Error</span> <span class="n">management</span> <span class="n">is</span> <span class="n">a</span> <span class="n">key</span> <span class="n">enabler</span> <span class="n">of</span> <span class="n">a</span> <span class="n">resilient</span> <span class="n">API</span> <span class="n">ecosystem</span><span class="p">.</span>
<span class="n">Enforcing</span> <span class="n">a</span> <span class="n">consistent</span> <span class="n">schema</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">errors</span> <span class="n">between</span> <span class="n">different</span> <span class="n">APIs</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="n">enables</span> <span class="n">client</span> <span class="n">to</span> <span class="n">properly</span> <span class="n">implement</span> <span class="n">an</span> <span class="n">error</span> <span class="n">management</span> <span class="n">strategy</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="n">with</span> <span class="n">positive</span> <span class="n">impacts</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">users</span><span class="p">.</span>

<span class="n">Error</span> <span class="n">responses</span> <span class="n">should</span> <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">one</span> <span class="n">of</span> <span class="n">the</span> <span class="n">media</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">type</span>
<span class="n">defined</span> <span class="k">in</span> <span class="n">RFC7807</span><span class="o">:</span>
<span class="o">-</span> <span class="err">`</span><span class="n">application</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">problem</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">json</span><span class="err">`</span>
<span class="o">-</span> <span class="err">`</span><span class="n">application</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">problem</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">xml</span><span class="err">`</span>

<span class="n">An</span> <span class="n">example</span> <span class="n">of</span> <span class="n">a</span> <span class="n">valid</span> <span class="n">response</span><span class="o">:</span>

<span class="err">```</span>
<span class="n">responses</span><span class="o">:</span>
  <span class="s">"503"</span><span class="o">:</span>
    <span class="n">content</span><span class="o">:</span>
      <span class="n">application</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">problem</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">json</span><span class="o">:</span>
        <span class="n">schema</span><span class="o">:</span>
          <span class="p">...</span>
<span class="err">```</span>   <span class="n">message</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="n">Error</span> <span class="n">responses</span> <span class="n">should</span> <span class="n">support</span> <span class="n">RFC7807</span> <span class="k">in</span> <span class="p">.</span>   <span class="n">formats</span><span class="o">:</span>
<span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">oas3</span>   <span class="n">severity</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="n">error</span>   <span class="n">given</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="err">$</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="n">paths</span><span class="p">.[</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">].</span><span class="n">responses</span><span class="p">[?(</span><span class="k">@property</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="n">match</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">/^</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="o">|</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="o">|</span><span class="k">default</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">))].</span><span class="n">content</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="o">*~</span>   <span class="n">then</span><span class="p">:</span>

(Link) - 

description: |-
  WARN: This rule is under implementation and just provides an hint.

Error management is a key enabler of a resilient API ecosystem.
  Enforcing a consistent schema for errors between different APIs,
  enables client to properly implement an error management strategy,
  with positive impacts for users.

This rule inspects the schema returned by an error response and
  verifies whether it contains the main properties defined in RFC7807:
  <code class="highlighter-rouge">status</code>, <code class="highlighter-rouge">title</code> and <code class="highlighter-rouge">detail</code>.

An example of a valid payload is
<div class="highlighter-rouge"><div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight"><code>  {
   "title": "Not Found",
   "status": 404,
   "detail": "Book does not exist; id: 123"
  }
</code></pre></div></div>

See recommendation RAC_REST_NAME_007.
message: Your schema doesnt seem to match RFC7807. Are you sure it is ok? 
formats:

  - oas3
severity: hint
recommended: false
given: $.paths.[*].responses[?(@property.match(/^(4|5|default)/))][[schema]]
then:
function: schema
functionOptions:
  schema:
    type: object
    properties:
      status:
        type: integer
      title:
        type: string
      detail:
        type: string
(Link) - 

description: |-
  The API version field should follow
  <a href="https://semver.org/#semantic-versioning-specification-semver">semantic versioning</a>.
severity: error
recommended: true
message: Specs should follow semantic versioning.  is not a valid version.
given: $.info.version
then:
  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: ^[0-9]+.[0-9]+.[0-9]+(-[a-z0-9+.-]+)?
(Link) -

description: The second path segment should be a whole-number version like <code class="highlighter-rouge">v1</code>.

  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: ^/[^/]+/v\d+/.+$

description: The second path segment should be a whole-number version like <code class="highlighter-rouge">v1</code>.

  function: pattern
  functionOptions:
    match: ^/[^/]+/v\d+/.+$

About this Linting Rules

This project is meant to make linting rules more accessible and usable across the governance of the design of OpenAPIs.
